Description:
The primary goal of the autopsy practicum component is to learn how to perform autopsies under the supervision of a pathologist. Knowledge from anatomy, physiology, histology, and human pathology will be incorporated in the training.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Master of Pathologists' Assistant program.

Also known as: (formerly Medical Science 749)
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, GFC Hours (0-3), WIL Field Placement, FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 0-3 ((0-3)), WIL - FPL (Field Placement)

Subject: MDPA - Medicine, Pathologists' Assistant
Description:
The primary goal of the autopsy practicum component is to learn how to perform autopsies under the supervision of a pathologist. Knowledge from anatomy, physiology, histology, and human pathology will be incorporated in the training.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Master of Pathologists' Assistant program.

Also known as: (formerly Medical Science 749)
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, GFC Hours (0-3), WIL Field Placement, FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 0-3 ((0-3)), WIL - FPL (Field Placement)

Subject: MDPA - Medicine, Pathologists' Assistant
Description:
Guided work with practical research, encouraging independent thought and collaboration with pathologists and clinical colleagues. Requires completion of written reports and oral presentation on research performed.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Master of Pathologists' Assistant program. 

Also known as: (formerly Medical Science 750)

Notes: Students are required to take both Medical Pathologists' Assistant 750.01 and 750.02.
Course Attributes: GFC Hours (0-4), Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, RCS Focused, FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 0-4 ((0-4)), RCS - FCS (Focused)

Subject: MDPA - Medicine, Pathologists' Assistant
Description:
Guided work with practical research, encouraging independent thought and collaboration with pathologists and clinical colleagues. Requires completion of written reports and oral presentation on research performed.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Master of Pathologists' Assistant program. 

Also known as: (formerly Medical Science 750)

Notes: Students are required to take both Medical Pathologists' Assistant 750.01 and 750.02.
Course Attributes: GFC Hours (0-4), Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, RCS Focused, FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 0-4 ((0-4)), RCS - FCS (Focused)

Subject: MDPH - Medical Physics
Description:
Concepts basic to the use of radiation for treatment of cancer patients.  Dose quantities, calculation systems, protocols and measurement.  Treatment machines.  Planning external beam and brachytherapy treatments.  Time-dose fractionation relationships.  Special techniques and therapies.  Exotic particle therapy including protons and neutrons.

Prerequisite(s): Consent of the Department.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, GFC Hours (3-0), FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0))

Subject: MDPH - Medical Physics
Description:
Clinical photon and electron beams, brachytherapy, treatment planning, radiation therapy devices, special techniques.

Prerequisite(s): Medical Physics 623 and consent of the Department.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, GFC Hours (3-0), FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0))

Subject: MDPH - Medical Physics
Long Course Title: Clinical Rotation in Radiation Oncology Physics
Description:
Clinical observation of radiotherapy for cancer. Students observe the treatment process, including immobilization, CT simulation and radiotherapy treatment. Treatments observed include conventional radiotherapy, intensity modulated radiotherapy, total body irradiation, stereotactic radiosurgery, brachytherapy.

Prerequisite(s): Medical Physics 623 and consent of the Department.

NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, GFC Hours (0-1.5), WIL Mandatory Clinical Placement, FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 0-1.5 ((0-1.5)), WIL - MCP (Mandatory Clinical Placement)

Subject: MDPH - Medical Physics
Description:
Absorption dose determination, dose descriptors, photon beam modelling, quality control.

Prerequisite(s): Medical Physics 625 and consent of the Department.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, GFC Hours (1-3), RCS Related, FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 1-3 ((1-3)), RCS - RLT (Related)

Subject: MDPH - Medical Physics
Long Course Title: Anatomy and Statistics for Medical Physicists
Description:
Introduction to medical statistics and mathematical methods in medical physics. Specific topics include: probability, statistical inference, hypothesis testing, rejection, regression, Monte Carlo methods, analysis of variance, nonparametric statistics, clinical trials, survival analysis, receiver-operator characteristic curves and optimization. Introduction to anatomy and physiology emphasis is placed on image-based anatomy, the major organ systems, and the physiology of therapeutic and oncological processes.

Prerequisite(s): Consent of the Department.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, GFC Hours (3-0), FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0))

Subject: MDPH - Medical Physics
Description:
An overview of the imaging modalities used for Radiation Oncology including: CT, MRI, planar X-ray, nuclear medicine and ultrasound. Course will cover basic physics, instrumentation and application.

Prerequisite(s):  Consent of the Department.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, GFC Hours (3-0), FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0))

Subject: MDPH - Medical Physics
Long Course Title: Radiobiology and Radiation Safety for Medical Physicists
Description:
Overview of relevant subjects in Radiobiology (the study of the effects of ionizing radiation on living things) and Radiation Safety. Radiobiology topics covered include cell kinetics, cell survival curves, radiation pathology and dose fractionation. Radiation Safety includes regulations and best practices meant to protect staff and members of the public from unsafe exposure to radiation. Material covered is drawn from the reports of multiple regulatory bodies and will include discussions of treatment vault shielding and design in Radiation Therapy facilities.

Prerequisite(s): Consent of the Department.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, GFC Hours (3-0), FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0))

Subject: MDPH - Medical Physics
Description:
Consists of rotations through areas of clinical physics under the supervision of adjunct faculty. Objectives are set, in conjunction with the student, at the commencement of the three rotations comprising this course. Student performance is evaluated by the course mentors at the conclusion of each rotation and by a final oral examination.

Prerequisite(s): Consent of the Department.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, GFC Hours (0-8), WIL Mandatory Clinical Placement, FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 0-8 ((0-8)), WIL - MCP (Mandatory Clinical Placement)

Subject: MDPH - Medical Physics
Description:
Consists of rotations through more complex areas of clinical physics under the supervision of adjunct faculty. Objectives are set, in conjunction with the student, at the commencement of the three rotations comprising this course. Student performance is evaluated by the course mentors at the conclusion of each rotation and by a final oral examination.

Prerequisite(s): Medical Physics 711 and consent of the Department.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, GFC Hours (0-8), WIL Mandatory Clinical Placement, FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 0-8 ((0-8)), WIL - MCP (Mandatory Clinical Placement)

Subject: MDPH - Medical Physics
Description:
Includes completion of multiple clinical projects in the disciplines of external beam radiotherapy, stereotactic radiosurgery, brachytherapy, and treatment planning. These clinical projects aim to build the student's understanding of implementing advanced technologies in a radiotherapy clinic. Projects have clearly defined objectives established by mutual agreement between the student and project supervisor. The project culminates in written reports and oral presentations.

Prerequisite(s): Consent of the Department.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, GFC Hours (0-8), RCS Focused, FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 0-8 ((0-8)), RCS - FCS (Focused)

Subject: MDPH - Medical Physics
Description:
Includes completion of multiple clinical projects in the disciplines of external beam radiotherapy, stereotactic radiosurgery, brachytherapy, and treatment planning. These clinical projects aim to build the student's understanding of implementing advanced technologies in a radiotherapy clinic. Projects have clearly defined objectives established by mutual agreement between the student and project supervisor. The project culminates in written reports and oral presentations.

Prerequisite(s): Medical Physics 721 and consent of the Department.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, GFC Hours (0-8), RCS Focused, FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 0-8 ((0-8)), RCS - FCS (Focused)

Subject: MDPH - Medical Physics
Description:
Requires the student to prepare written answers to pre-set questions published by the Canadian College of Physicists in Medicine as part of the certification process in Radiation Oncology Physics.

Prerequisite(s): Consent of the Department.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, GFC Hours (0-2T), FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 0-2T ((0-2T))

Subject: MDPH - Medical Physics
Description:
Designed to nurture knowledgeable and clinically competent treatment planning physicists. Develops background understanding of the mechanisms of dose calculation and radiation deliverability. As well, site specific treatment planning is a focus to ensure students are ready to practice as clinically competent medical physicists. The practical component allows the resident to train under the direct supervision of physicists and dosimetrists.

Prerequisite(s): Consent of the Department.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A, Fee Rate Group(International) -B, GFC Hours (1-4), WIL Mandatory Clinical Placement, FRGD - A (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - A), FRGI - B (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - B), GFCH - 1-4 ((1-4)), WIL - MCP (Mandatory Clinical Placement)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
A key skill in the field of precision health is the ability to critically analyse precision health through the lens of person-centred care and transdisciplinary perspectives, including the role that education, innovation, data literacy, technology, and ethical leadership have in the precision health ecosystem.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0))

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Long Course Title: Ethics and Law of Precision Health
Description:
The practice of precision health raises unique ethical and legal questions. Explore: a) the bioethical and legal principles underlying precision health; b) consent, privacy, and use of data; c) the social impact of precision health; d) patient safety and the responsibilities of health professionals and organizations; and e) equitable access, stewardship of resources, and the development of health technology.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0))

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
A critical examination of leadership development in the era of precision health as it relates to individual leadership practices, multi-disciplinary teams and the broader healthcare system. Exploration of new frameworks to facilitate collaborative decision making and effecting change and using critical appraisal to identify the most relevant research and make evidence-based decisions to problem-solve around real issues in health systems.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0))

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Long Course Title: Managing Complex Projects in Precision Health
Description:
Explore complexity from system and project perspectives and link complexity to the design and delivery of precision health projects. Apply project management approaches and tools for planning and executing complex innovation and change projects. Emphasis is placed on innovative (novel and useful) precision health ideas and projects. 

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), RCS Related, FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0)), RCS - RLT (Related)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
Omics technologies have revolutionized data collection, patient diagnosis, and disease management. A number of key omics technology platforms will be introduced, with a particular focus on the clinical use of genomic data and their application in research.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), RCS Related, FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0)), RCS - RLT (Related)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
An introduction to clinical pharmacogenomics, including nomenclature, guidelines, software tools, and considerations for clinical implementation of pharmacogenetic testing. Activities and assessments will reflect real-world application of pharmacogenomics.  

Prerequisite(s): Medical Precision Health 610 and admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), RCS Related, FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0)), RCS - RLT (Related)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
An introduction to the genetics and immunology of cancer and how genetics are being used for diagnosis, prognostication, and treatment. Topics include: clinical applications of precision oncology; molecular concepts and databases relevant to clinical care and research; cancer clinical trials; ethical considerations in the application of precision oncology; and the multidisciplinary nature of the field.

Prerequisite(s): Medical Precision Health 610 and admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), RCS Related, FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0)), RCS - RLT (Related)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
Concepts and ideas in artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning -- including statistical approaches, visualization, and human-computer interactions. Applications of AI techniques and software tools. This will primarily involve exploring recent examples of AI and Machine Learning tools being specifically used to aid in clinical practice.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0))

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
An advanced seminar course covering recently published examples of precision medicine. Students will critically evaluate the subjects of discussion, creatively explore ways in which precision medicine studies and tools could be developed, and will focus on ways in which they can lead health system transformation such that the benefits of precision medicine are more widely realized for their patients.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Master of Precision Health, Precision Medicine specialization.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), RCS Related, FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0)), RCS - RLT (Related)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
Quality management principles and science will be introduced starting with quality management frameworks and theory that will guide and rationalize students' learning. Quality management tools for data analysis, prioritization, improvement and change management will be introduced and described which will help students succeed in quality improvement projects.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0))

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
An introduction to safety science and the key concepts for managing patients' safety in the healthcare system. Topics will include the exploration of proactive and reactive safety management, recognizing the similarities and differences with quality management and learning concepts of managing a serious patient harm event with a focus on system analysis.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0))

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
Understanding the theories and principles of quality management will provide you with an opportunity to acquire the skills required to design, implement, and evaluate a quality improvement or safety analysis project. 

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Master of Precision Health, Quality and Safety Leadership specialization.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), RCS Related, FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0)), RCS - RLT (Related)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
Students will learn how to adapt teaching and assessment practices in response to changing contexts, new research, and advancing technologies. Emphasis is placed on health professional education in precision health contexts and competency-based medical education.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0))

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
Acquiring the ability to review health professional curriculum ensures that it aligns with the requirements of accreditors, legislators, and other governing bodies. Topics include: quality improvement for curriculum, with a particular emphasis on modifications for Precision Health initiatives.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, the Master of Precision Health.

Note: With permission from the Graduate Program Director, course is open to other students.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0))

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
Engage with concepts in curriculum leadership with a particular attention to leading adaptations of educational curricula in response to external forces. You Students will be supported to work with teams to maximize strengths and establish a space that fosters advancements in health professional education. There is a specific focus is on the skills needed to lead new education initiatives for precision health. 

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), RCS Related, FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0)), RCS - RLT (Related)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Long Course Title: Advanced Curriculum Design in Precision Health
Description:
Create, implement and evaluate an innovative curriculum in the field of precision health, based on sound principles of curricular design and delivery. This course invites consideration of interprofessional learning, equity, diversity and inclusion, and integration of advanced technologies.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Master of Precision Health,  Health Professional Education Leadership specialization.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), RCS Focused, FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0)), RCS - FCS (Focused)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Long Course Title: Entrepreneurial Thinking and Innovation in Precision Health
Description:
Application of entrepreneurial thinking principles to develop innovative ideas in a range of contexts: private or public sector, for-profit or non-profit. Particular emphasis is placed on generating innovative (novel and useful) ideas in a precision health context and bringing those to market.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, or the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, the Master of Precision Health.

Antirequisite(s): Credit for Medical Precision Health 640 and Entrepreneurship and Innovation 625 will not be allowed. 

Note: With permission from the Graduate Program Director, course is open to other students.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), RCS Focused, FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0)), RCS - FCS (Focused)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Long Course Title: Sustainable Business Cases for Precision Health Innovations
Description:
Building strong cases for innovative ideas in precision health systems, based on objective and holistic analysis through the application of business model analysis, economic analysis, benefit realization, and health technology assessments. The course addresses internal projects within healthcare systems and new venturing ideas.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), RCS Focused, FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0)), RCS - FCS (Focused)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
Planning and organizing the execution of precision health innovation projects within health care systems, including budgeting, mobilizing financial resources, and strategic planning. Concentration on both internal projects within healthcare systems and new venturing ideas. An emphasis is placed on publicly funded healthcare systems.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.

Note: With permission from the Graduate Program Director, course is open to other students.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), RCS Focused, FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0)), RCS - FCS (Focused)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Long Course Title: Managing Technology Development in Precision Health
Description:
Planning and organizing the implementation of technology development projects in precision health (e.g., software, wearable devices, big data applications, etc.). Particular topics include technology development approaches, planning for execution, budgeting, and minimal viable products.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), RCS Focused, FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0)), RCS - FCS (Focused)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
Application of insights from the research literature for selecting appropriate approaches for planning and executing system-level innovative projects in precision health. Particular topics include barriers to healthcare innovations and frameworks (financial, organizational, informational) for implementing system-level innovations.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Master of Precision Health, Innovation and Entrepreneurship specialization.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), RCS Related, FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0)), RCS - RLT (Related)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
Data visualization skills enhance the ability to interpret and communicate facts to stakeholders. Students will work with quantitative and qualitative data to derive meaning and present options for decision-making, develop data-informed health care questions, identify measures, analyze data sets, and discuss how to work with data analysts and patient partners. 

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), RCS Focused, FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0)), RCS - FCS (Focused)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
An understanding of human skills and limitations can improve the ability to design better healthcare systems that reduce the likelihood of errors and improve patient outcomes. Explore the theory and data pertaining to the relationships between humans, technology, and environments. 

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Graduate Certificate in Precision Health, the Graduate Diploma in Precision Health, or the Master of Precision Health.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (3-0), RCS Related, FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 3-0 ((3-0)), RCS - RLT (Related)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Long Course Title: Experiential Learning: Project Planning and Implementation
Description:
Develop a project proposal and implement a capstone project with a community partner or researcher, applying existing knowledge and skills at an advanced level.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the Master of Precision Health.

Also known as: (formerly Medical Precision Health 682 and 683)

Notes: Must be completed in sequence with Medical Precision Health 686 within a single academic year, otherwise must be repeated.
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H, Fee Rate Group(International) -I, GFC Hours (25 hrs - 100 hrs), RCS Focused, FRGD - H (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - H), FRGI - I (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - I), GFCH - 25HR-100HR ((25 hrs - 100 hrs)), RCS - FCS (Focused)

Subject: MDPR - Medical Precision Health
Description:
Evaluate the experiential learning capstone project by synthesizing data collected, then reflecting and synthesizing key findings.

Prerequisite(s): Medical Precision Health 685 and admission to the Master of Precision Health. 

Also known as: (formerly Medical Precision Health 684)

Notes: Must be completed in sequence with Medical Precision Health 685 within a single academic year, otherwise must be repeated.

Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Long Course Title: Fundamentals I - Health Across the Life Cycle
Description:
Building on the knowledge of basic sciences, anatomy, physiology and introductory clinical skills, this course highlights the comprehensive understanding of healthcare principles and practices across various life stages. It encompasses the care of individuals from birth through adulthood and into old age, emphasizing the holistic approach to healthcare.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the MPAS program.

NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: GFC Hours (160 HOURS), Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I, Fee Rate Group(International) -J, FRGD - I (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I), FRGI - J (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - J), GFCH - 160 HOURS ((160 HOURS))

Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Description:
This course delves deeper into clinical sciences and practical applications, and the management of both acute and chronic diseases. It equips students with the skills and expertise needed to address a wide range of medical conditions, from sudden, critical illnesses to long-term health challenges across various life stages.


Prerequisite(s): Medicine, Physicians Assistant 611, 621, 631 and admission to the MPAS program. 

NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: GFC Hours (160 HOURS), Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I, Fee Rate Group(International) -J, FRGD - I (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I), FRGI - J (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - J), GFCH - 160 HOURS ((160 HOURS))

Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Long Course Title: Fundamentals III - Complex and Chronic Care, Part I
Description:
In this course, students engage with advanced clinical concepts and gain insights into complex care scenarios. This component prepares them to navigate intricate patient cases, tackle multifaceted challenges, and transition towards more immersive learning experiences within the healthcare landscape.

Prerequisites: Medicine, Physicians Assistant 612, 622, 632, and admission to the MPAS program 

NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: GFC Hours (80 HOURS), Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I, Fee Rate Group(International) -J, FRGD - I (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I), FRGI - J (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - J), GFCH - 80 HOURS ((80 HOURS))

Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Long Course Title: Fundamentals III - Complex and Chronic Care, Part II
Description:
In this course, students will build on the knowledge gained in Medicine, Physicians Assistant 613 and continue to engage with advanced clinical concepts and complex care scenarios. Students deepen their understanding of multiple complex chronic conditions and patients with comorbidities. Students also learn how socio-economic, cultural, and environmental dimensions play a significant role in complex and chronic care.

Prerequisites: Medicine, Physicians Assistant 613, 623, 633 and admission to the MPAS program. 

NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: GFC Hours (80 HOURS), Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I, Fee Rate Group(International) -J, FRGD - I (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I), FRGI - J (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - J), GFCH - 80 HOURS ((80 HOURS))

Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Description:
Foundations of Practice I provides students with a comprehensive understanding of the multifaceted aspects that underpin their future roles as healthcare professionals. Students will be introduced to the concept of interprofessional collaboration and teamwork, ethical considerations in healthcare, advocacy, health equity, social and structural determinants of health, the needs of marginalized populations, critical appraisal of medical literature, and the role of the physician assistant as part of the health care team. Students may shadow other healthcare professions or collaborate with various organizations, thereby gaining invaluable real-world insights.

Prerequisites: Admission to the MPAS program. 

NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: GFC Hours  (96 HOURS), Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I, Fee Rate Group(International) -J, FRGD - I (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I), FRGI - J (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - J), GFCH - 96 HOURS ((96 HOURS))

Students will gain in-depth knowledge of the concept of interprofessional collaboration and teamwork, critical appraisal of medical literature, the physician assistant role within healthcare, and incorporate ethical considerations in decision making. Students will apply knowledge of advocacy, health equity, social and structural determinants of health, and the needs of marginalized populations as part of the health care team. Description:
Foundations of Practice VI provides students the opportunity to consolidate the experiences gained through immersive and diverse learning experiences by applying knowledge in the multifaceted aspects that underpin their future roles as healthcare professionals. In addition, students participate in interprofessional collaboration and teamwork, and elaborate on the physician assistant role within healthcare, while applying ethical considerations in decision making in comprehensive healthcare situations. Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Description:
Clinical Skills I introduce MPAS students to the practical and hands-on skills essential for successful healthcare practice. Students will acquire a solid foundation in interpersonal and communication skills required for effective history-taking, physical examination, communication, and medical documentation skills necessary for patient assessment. Students will delve into the critical skill of interpreting diagnostic tests and building procedural skills, bridging the gap between clinical assessment and evidence-based decision-making. This course also includes the requirement of the Medical Terminology Module.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the MPAS program.
 
NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: GFC Hours (64 HOURS), Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I, Fee Rate Group(International) -J, FRGD - I (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I), FRGI - J (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - J), GFCH - 64 HOURS ((64 HOURS))

Description:

Students will expand on the foundation gained in interpersonal and communication skills required for effective history-taking, physical examination, communication, and medical documentation skills necessary for patient assessment. Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Description:
MPAS students will gain skills required for the provision of care for family medicine patients across the life span, within the urban area. Under the supervision of a preceptor, they engage in the diagnosis, management, and treatment of acute, chronic, and the provision of preventive medical care to family medicine patients.

Prerequisites: Admission to the MPAS program. 

NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I, Fee Rate Group(International) -J, GFC Hours (160 HOURS), FRGD - I (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I), FRGI - J (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - J), GFCH - 160 HOURS ((160 HOURS))

Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Description:
MPAS students will gain skills required for the provision of care for family medicine patients across the life span in rural areas. This supervised clinical practice experience enables students to assess patients seeking medical care within community-based environments with an emphasis on caring for the acutely and chronically ill patients, in addition to providing preventive medical care to family medicine patients.

Prerequisites: Admission to the MPAS program.
 
NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I, Fee Rate Group(International) -J, GFC Hours (160 HOURS), FRGD - I (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I), FRGI - J (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - J), GFCH - 160 HOURS ((160 HOURS))

Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Description:
This clinical rotation provides the MPAS student with clinical experience required to triage, evaluate, diagnose, and manage patients with life-threatening illness in urgent care and emergency settings. Students will gain experience and skills in all elements of health-care delivery for diverse patients across the lifespan.

Prerequisites: Admission to the MPAS program.
 
NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: GFC Hours (160 HOURS), Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I, Fee Rate Group(International) -J, FRGD - I (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I), FRGI - J (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - J), GFCH - 160 HOURS ((160 HOURS))

Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Description:
This clinical rotation exposes the MPAS student to the principles and practice of psychiatry, behavioral, and mental health. Students will develop skills in the recognition, clinical evaluation, and diagnosis of psychiatric illness, and collaborate in the management of patients with psychiatric clinical presentations across the lifespan.

Prerequisites: Admission to the MPAS program. 

NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: GFC Hours (160 HOURS), Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I, Fee Rate Group(International) -J, FRGD - I (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I), FRGI - J (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - J), GFCH - 160 HOURS ((160 HOURS))

Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Description:
This clinical rotation exposes the MPAS student with practical clinical experience to women's health with a focus on obstetrics and gynaecology. Students will develop skills in history taking, physical examinations, and collaborating in making medical decisions for a broad range of patients with diverse socio-economic status.

Prerequisites: Admission to the MPAS program. 

NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: GFC Hours (160 HOURS), Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I, Fee Rate Group(International) -J, FRGD - I (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I), FRGI - J (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - J), GFCH - 160 HOURS ((160 HOURS))

Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Description:
This core rotation offers hands-on clinical experience in an acute inpatient internal medicine unit, focusing on the diagnosis, management, and problem-solving for patients with acute and chronic illnesses. Students will also develop skills in preventive care and patient education. As part of an interdisciplinary healthcare team, students will actively contribute to the comprehensive care of adult patients, enhancing their ability to deliver effective and patient-centered management in a collaborative environment. 

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the MPAS program.

NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I, Fee Rate Group(International) -J, GFC Hours (160 HOURS), WIL Mandatory Clinical Placement, FRGD - I (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I), FRGI - J (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - J), GFCH - 160 HOURS ((160 HOURS)), WIL - MCP (Mandatory Clinical Placement)

Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Description:
Immersion in a subspecialty of Internal Medicine, offering focused exposure to complex and specialized patient care scenarios. Students will enhance their proficiency in diagnosing, managing, and treating subspecialty conditions while collaborating with multidisciplinary teams. Emphasis is placed on integrating advanced clinical reasoning and evidence-based approaches within the chosen subspecialty, fostering skill development in specialized patient management, communication, and teamwork in diverse healthcare settings.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the MPAS program.

NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I, Fee Rate Group(International) -J, GFC Hours (80 HOURS), WIL Mandatory Clinical Placement, FRGD - I (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I), FRGI - J (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - J), GFCH - 80 HOURS ((80 HOURS)), WIL - MCP (Mandatory Clinical Placement)

Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Description:
Practical clinical experience with pediatric patients. Students will gain skills in the process of evaluating, diagnosing, managing, and delivering care to a pediatric population. The experiences will be broad including newborn care and care of children and adolescents up to the age of 18. 

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the MPAS program.

NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: WIL Mandatory Clinical Placement, Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I, Fee Rate Group(International) -J, GFC Hours (160 HOURS), FRGD - I (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I), FRGI - J (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - J), GFCH - 160 HOURS ((160 HOURS)), WIL - MCP (Mandatory Clinical Placement)

Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Description:
Specialized clinical exposure within a subspecialty of pediatrics. Building on foundational pediatric competencies, students will deepen their expertise in the evaluation, diagnosis, and management of complex conditions specific to a pediatric subspecialty. Emphasis is placed on collaborative care, evidence-based practices, and developing advanced clinical reasoning skills to address the unique needs of children and adolescents in specialized healthcare settings.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the MPAS program.

NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I, Fee Rate Group(International) -J, GFC Hours (80 HOURS), WIL Mandatory Clinical Placement, FRGD - I (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I), FRGI - J (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - J), GFCH - 80 HOURS ((80 HOURS)), WIL - MCP (Mandatory Clinical Placement)

Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Description:
The core surgical rotation provides the MPAS student with practical clinical experience in the concepts and principles of general surgery. Students will gain clinical skills in the process of evaluating, diagnosing, managing, and making appropriate surgical referrals under the supervision of preceptors within this field. 

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the MPAS program.

NOT INCLUDED IN GPA
Course Attributes: Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I, Fee Rate Group(International) -J, GFC Hours (160 HOURS), WIL Mandatory Clinical Placement, FRGD - I (Fee Rate Group(Domestic) - I), FRGI - J (Fee Rate Group(Int'l) - J), GFCH - 160 HOURS ((160 HOURS)), WIL - MCP (Mandatory Clinical Placement)

Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Description:
This clinical rotation offers MPAS students focused clinical experience within a surgical subspecialty. Building on the principles of general surgery, students will refine their skills in evaluating, diagnosing, managing, and collaborating on surgical care for patients with complex and specialized conditions. Emphasis is placed on hands-on learning, procedural competencies, and multidisciplinary collaboration under the supervision of surgical specialists.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the MPAS program.

NOT INCLUDED IN GPA

Subject: MDPS - Medicine, Physicians Assistant
Description:
This rotation provides MPAS students with the opportunity to gain focused clinical experience in a specialized area of family medicine, ideally as aligned with the Certificates of Added Competence (CAC) framework. Under the supervision of a family physician preceptor, students will enhance their diagnostic, management, and treatment skills within the chosen specialty, such as emergency medicine, care of the elderly, palliative care, or sports medicine. The rotation emphasizes patient-centered care across diverse practice settings, fostering adaptability and advanced competency in the delivery of comprehensive, evidence-based medical care.

Prerequisites: Admission to the MPAS program.

Prerequisite(s): Admission to the MPAS program.

NOT INCLUDED IN GPA

Students work under the supervision of a licensed clinical preceptor to engage in experiential learning experiences within healthcare and gain additional or new clinical experience.

Description:
